alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued March 10 at 1:28AM PST until March 10 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility of a quarter mile or less in freezing fog. * WHERE...Central Douglas County. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost on bridges. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very light ice accumulations are possible on roadways or surfaces in freezing fog. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * If possible, wait for temperatures to warm above freezing before traveling. * Slow down and give 3 times as much space as normal between vehicles. * Shaded areas may be more slippery than unshaded areas. * Use low beams. High beams reflect back fog making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are. * Be ready for low visibility by keeping your headlights clean. * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.
